intro: Nomochloa rufa var. neogaea, commonly known as the red-stemmed spurge, is a perennial flowering plant native to parts of eastern North America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is characterized by its milky sap and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a reddish tinge on the underside. The small, greenish-yellow flowers are clustered in cup-like structures called cyathia, which are typical of the genus.
